results.title: Communism
results.brief_description: An example of a propaganda film made in the United States in the early 1950’s informing the viewer of the evils of communism and how to detect those with communist beliefs. Includes historical footage.

results.title: Communication case book
results.brief_description: Four case histories exploring an area of communication. The Case of the tuned-out mind: Communication is a two-way exchange in which the situation alters as each party responds to the other. The Case of the wrong wave-length: The ability to find and use the particular approach that will be most effective with each different individual. The Case of the chain-reaction: How we communicate is as important as what we communicate. The Case of the silent yell: Unspoken communication and its effect on goals and on our relationship with other people.

results.title: Communication by voice and action
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of gestures, expression, posture, voice and body movement in communication. Communication is a two way process between the speaker and the listener, so things must be said and done to clearly indicate the speaker’s thoughts and feelings.

results.title: Communication and motivation: dealing successfully with today's students
results.brief_description: One of a series in which Dr William Glasser presents a problem solving approach for individuals in therapeutic situations and which can be applied to discipline in schools. Glasser combines his discussion of the Schools Without Failure concepts, and examines the ways in which motivation can be encouraged - laughter and fun, and the importance of self expression give a child recognition that will motivate him to work. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.

results.title: Communicating effectively
results.creator_credit: Caryl Wickman, Nancy Evelyn and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Essential Skill for Job Success”.
Explores communications techniques, including both verbal and nonverbal skills, and stresses the importance of effective communication.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 21
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: Ice breakers at work in the Gulf of St Lawrence; Asian students in New Zealand under the Colombo Plan; Adventure training for girls at Kenya’s Outward Bound School; Commonwealth students assist with testing spectographic analysis machines; The centenary celebrations of the Ballygunge Cricket Club in Calcutta; The Commonwealth stand at the Schoolboy’s Exhibition in London.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 15
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: Fishing under the ice in Canadian lakes; The visit of the Malaysian Welfare Officers to a Government Rehabilitation Centre in Britain; a Nigerian organist at Cambridge University; a Trinidad textile designer in London; The training of the staff of Radio Uganda; Horse racing throughout the Commonwealth, showing the training of jockeys and their mounts.
